project.name: Task Manager 2
project.description: Build a simple todo list application platform for personal task management serving 100+ active users. Key features: create tasks, mark complete, organize by categories, due dates, priority levels, search and filter. Scale to small team usage with real-time sync and ensure basic authentication and data privacy compliance.

relationships.description: A task is associated with one priority level
A task is associated with one category
A task is assigned to one user
A task can have multiple comments
A comment is made by one user
A task can have multiple tags and a tag can be associated with multiple tasks
A task can have multiple logs

indexRecommendations.reason: Frequent queries by task and date
Frequent queries by task and log date
Frequent filtering by category and priority

normalizationIssues.suggestion: Consider moving task status to a separate table to reduce data redundancy
Add a parent_comment_id field to establish a comment hierarchy

performanceWarnings: Frequent inserts and updates on the tasks table may lead to index fragmentation
The task_tags table may grow large and cause performance issues if not properly indexed
Inadequate indexing on the task_comments and task_logs tables may lead to slow query performance

decisions.title: Database Selection
decisions.description: Choose the best database solution for storing task data, user information, and settings with strong ACID compliance and query performance

recommendations.name: PostgreSQL
recommendations.description: Advanced open-source relational database with excellent ACID compliance, rich feature set including JSON support, full-text search, and extensibility through custom functions and extensions
pros: Rich feature set with JSON and JSONB support
cons: Steeper learning curve compared to MySQL

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

recommendations.name: MySQL
recommendations.description: Popular open-source relational database known for reliability, ease of use, and wide adoption in web applications with strong read performance

pricing.details: Free and open-source, hosting costs vary

recommendations.name: MongoDB
recommendations.description: Document-oriented NoSQL database with flexible schema design, horizontal scaling capabilities, and rich query language for handling unstructured data

pricing.details: Community edition free, Enterprise features and Atlas managed service paid

recommendations.name: Amazon Aurora
recommendations.description: Cloud-native relational database with MySQL and PostgreSQL compatibility, offering 5x performance improvement with automated backups, auto-scaling storage, and multi-AZ deployments

pricing.details: Pay for compute, storage, and I/O separately. Costs scale with usage.

decisions.reasoning: PostgreSQL is recommended for this task management platform due to its strong ACID compliance ensuring data integrity for transactions, excellent support for complex queries needed for task searches and analytics, and JSON support for flexible task attributes. The open-source nature keeps costs low while providing enterprise-grade features. Strong community support and extensive documentation reduce development risk.

decisions.title: API Gateway Selection
decisions.description: Choose the API gateway solution for managing API traffic, security, and monitoring

recommendations.name: AWS API Gateway
recommendations.description: Fully managed API gateway service for creating, publishing, maintaining, monitoring, and securing APIs at scale
pros: Supports RESTful APIs and WebSocket APIs
Integration with AWS services like Lambda and S3
Security features like authentication and rate limiting

pricing.details: Pay for API calls, data transfer, and cache storage. Free tier available.

recommendations.name: Kong
recommendations.description: Open-source API gateway and service mesh for managing API traffic, security, and monitoring with a large community and extensive plugin ecosystem
pros: Supports multiple protocols like HTTP, gRPC, and WebSockets
Security features like authentication and rate limiting

pricing.details: Free and open-source, infrastructure costs for hosting

recommendations.name: NGINX
recommendations.description: Popular open-source web server and reverse proxy for managing API traffic, security, and monitoring with a large community and extensive configuration options
pros: Supports multiple protocols like HTTP and TCP
Security features like authentication and rate limiting

pricing.details: Free and open-source, infrastructure costs for hosting

decisions.reasoning: AWS API Gateway is recommended for its scalability, security features, and integration with AWS services like Lambda and S3. The managed service model reduces the operational burden and provides a cost-effective solution for API management.

decisions.title: Cache Layer Selection
decisions.description: Choose the cache solution for improving application performance and reducing database load

recommendations.name: Redis
recommendations.description: In-memory data store for caching and real-time data processing with high performance and low latency
pros: Supports multiple data structures like strings, hashes, and lists
Pub/sub messaging model for real-time communication

pricing.details: Free and open-source, infrastructure costs for hosting

recommendations.name: Memcached
recommendations.description: High-performance caching system for reducing database load and improving application performance
cons: Limited support for multiple data structures
No support for pub/sub messaging model

pricing.details: Free and open-source, infrastructure costs for hosting

decisions.reasoning: Redis is recommended for its high performance, low latency, and support for multiple data structures. The open-source nature and large community reduce the operational burden and provide a cost-effective solution for caching.

recommendations.name: GitHub Actions
recommendations.description: Integrated CI/CD platform built into GitHub with workflow automation, rich marketplace of actions, and seamless integration with repositories
cons: Pricing for private repos can add up

pricing.details: Free for public repos, pay-per-use for private repos (2,000 free minutes/month)

recommendations.name: GitLab CI/CD
recommendations.description: Integrated DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD, security scanning, container registry, and comprehensive deployment capabilities

pricing.details: Free tier available, paid plans for advanced features (400 CI/CD minutes free)

decisions.reasoning: GitHub Actions is recommended for its seamless integration with GitHub repositories, ease of setup with YAML-based workflows, and rich marketplace of pre-built actions. The low complexity and excellent documentation enable rapid implementation.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Microservices Architecture
smartRecommendations.description: Design the application as a collection of small, independent services, each responsible for a specific feature, such as task management, authentication, and search. This will allow for easier maintenance, scalability, and fault tolerance. Use APIs for communication between services.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Redis for Real-Time Sync
smartRecommendations.description: Utilize Redis, an in-memory data store, to enable real-time synchronization of tasks across users. This will ensure that all users have the most up-to-date task information, and changes are reflected instantly. Implement pub/sub messaging pattern for efficient data propagation.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Basic Authentication with OAuth
smartRecommendations.description: Use OAuth, an industry-standard authorization framework, to provide basic authentication for users. This will ensure secure and standardized authentication, and allow for easy integration with other services. Use a library like Passport.js to simplify implementation.

smartRecommendations.title: Optimize Database Queries with Indexing
smartRecommendations.description: Use indexing to optimize database queries, particularly for search and filter features. Create indexes on columns used in WHERE, JOIN, and ORDER BY clauses to improve query performance. Use a database management system like MySQL or PostgreSQL to leverage indexing capabilities.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Load Balancing for Scalability
smartRecommendations.description: Implement load balancing to distribute incoming traffic across multiple instances of the application, ensuring scalability and high availability. Use a load balancer like HAProxy or NGINX to direct traffic to available instances, and use cloud providers like AWS or Google Cloud to easily scale instances.

smartRecommendations.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data with SSL/TLS
smartRecommendations.description: Use SSL/TLS encryption to protect sensitive user data, such as passwords and task information, both in transit and at rest. Use a library like OpenSSL to generate certificates and encrypt data, and ensure that all communication between the client and server is encrypted.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Create indexes on frequently queried columns
optimizationSuggestions.description: Create indexes on columns such as task_id, user_id, category_id, due_date, and priority_level to improve query performance. This will speed up tasks like searching, filtering, and retrieving tasks for a specific user or category.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement Redis caching for frequently accessed data
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use Redis to cache frequently accessed data such as user information, category lists, and priority levels. This will reduce the load on the database and improve application performance.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Optimize database queries for task retrieval
optimizationSuggestions.description: Optimize database queries to retrieve tasks for a specific user or category. Use techniques such as query optimization, connection pooling, and lazy loading to improve performance.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Use load balancing to distribute traffic
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use load balancing to distribute traffic across multiple servers. This will improve application availability and scalability, ensuring that the application can handle a large number of users.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement rate limiting and IP blocking
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement rate limiting and IP blocking to prevent brute-force attacks and denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. This will improve application security and prevent unauthorized access.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Schedule regular database backups and cleanup
optimizationSuggestions.description: Schedule regular database backups and cleanup to ensure data integrity and prevent data loss. This will also improve application performance by removing unnecessary data.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement monitoring and alerting for application performance
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement monitoring and alerting for application performance to detect issues before they become critical. Use tools such as New Relic or Prometheus to monitor application performance and receive alerts when issues arise.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
securityRecommendations.description: Add MFA to the login process to prevent unauthorized access. This can be done using time-based one-time passwords (TOTP) or universal 2nd factor (U2F) to provide an additional layer of security beyond just passwords.

securityRecommendations.title: Use End-to-End Encryption for Task Data
securityRecommendations.description: Encrypt task data both in transit and at rest to protect user data from unauthorized access. Use HTTPS for data in transit and consider using a library like OpenSSL for data at rest.

securityRecommendations.title: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for Task Management
securityRecommendations.description: Implement RBAC to restrict access to tasks based on user roles. For example, only allow team administrators to manage tasks for all team members, while regular users can only manage their own tasks.

securityRecommendations.title: Regularly Update Dependencies and Libraries
securityRecommendations.description: Keep all dependencies and libraries up to date to prevent vulnerabilities. Use tools like npm audit or pip-compile to identify and update outdated dependencies.

securityRecommendations.title: Monitor and Log Security-Related Events
securityRecommendations.description: Implement logging and monitoring to detect and respond to security-related events, such as login attempts, task modifications, and data access. Use tools like ELK Stack or Splunk to monitor logs.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Password Policies and Password Hashing
securityRecommendations.description: Enforce strong password policies, such as password length and complexity requirements, and use a secure password hashing algorithm like bcrypt or Argon2 to store passwords securely.
